title: R & Python Cheat Sheet
text:
My R & Python Cheat Sheet

I am an R user who is leaning Python. I’m building a reference cheat sheet to compare both language.

title: 1  String
text:
course_r <- "R programming"

typeof(course_r)
## [1] "character"
length(course_r)
## [1] 1
nchar(course_r)
## [1] 13


1.0.1 Slicing

course[0]
## 'P'
course[-1]
## 'g'
course[0:3]
## 'Pyt'
course[:3]
## 'Pyt'
course[0:]
## 'Python programming'
course[:]
## 'Python programming'


substr(course_r, 1, 1)
## [1] "R"
substr(course_r, 1, 4)
## [1] "R pr"



1.0.2 Escape

print("python \"programming\' \nis fun")
## python "programming' 
## is fun


cat("R\n is also fun")
## R
##  is also fun



1.0.3 Formatted String

first = "Kittipos"
last = "Sirivongrungson"

print(f"{first} {last} is {len(first + last)} letter long")
## Kittipos Sirivongrungson is 23 letter long


first <-  "Kittipos"
last <-  "Sirivongrungson"

glue::glue("{first} {last} is {nchar(paste0(first, last))} letter long")
## Kittipos Sirivongrungson is 23 letter long
